beers.name: Select
beers.tastingNote: Amber in appearance, with a thick, dense head that is well-retained. It offers aromas of jammy fruit, some resin, and caramel, alongside a hint of citrus. The palate similarly offers stone fruit as well as a certain softness, with some oxidisation.

beers.name: IPA
beers.tastingNote: Hazy amber, with a loose head. The aromas offered are mainly citrus and tangerine, alongside stone fruit like apricot and peach, with biscuit malt just underneath. This is full-bodied to taste, and quite rich and creamy, although well-balanced.

beers.name: Drunken Sailor
beers.tastingNote: Hoppy, citrus and grassy aromas. Clear, dark golden in colour. Plenty of citrus hops. A slightly malty undertone still remains. An every-day IPA.

beers.name: Ur-Radler
beers.tastingNote: Lovely foam and head. Wonderful sherbet and lemon aroma, offering a lovely balance of bitter and sweet – fresh, clean and lemony on the nose with notes of lime and grapefruit. Clean and appetising on the palate with some slight sour tannic grapefruit and punchy flavours, but still well-balanced.

beers.name: Pfeffersack
beers.abv: "Great aromas straight away of spicy pepper and florals, hints of rosemary and lavender. Dry on the palate with a good balance of spicy flavours and a great bitterness. Lingering finish."

beers.name: Heimdalls Willkomm
beers.brewery: Beer of the Gods - Wacken Brauerei

beers.name: Coffee Quad
beers.tastingNote: Wonderful nose of cold brew coffee, raisins and chocolate. Followed by flavours with rich caramel, tracle and dark stone fruit. Good amount of sweetness coming through as well. Finish is sweet and lingering.

beers.name: Einherjer Sold
beers.brewery: Beer of the Gods - Wacken Brauerei

beers.name: Rest In Peace
beers.tastingNote: All that a barley wine need. Dried fruits on the nose, hints of bread and toffee. Lovely play between hop bitterness and sweetness. Lingering aftertaste.

beers.name: Yggdrasil
beers.brewery: Beer of the Gods - Wacken Brauerei

beers.name: Pale Ale
beers.tastingNote: Nice hoppy nose with red fruit and citrus. Palate is lighter than expected but with nice yellow stone fruit flavours, hops and balanced bitterness. Clean finish. Overall well balanced and carbonated.

beers.name: Crafty Loki
beers.brewery: Beer of the Gods - Wacken Brauerei

beers.name: Walkürenschluck Eisbock Edition
beers.brewery: Beer of the Gods - Wacken Brauerei
beers.tastingNote: Sweet on the nose with dried stone fruit, honey and caramel as well as rum notes. Mouthcoating with an alcoholic warmth. Beautiful malt flavours with dark sugar and fruit sweetness. Lingering finish.

beers.name: Roggen-Weizen
beers.tastingNote: Beautiful dark colour, clear with a good amoutn fo carbonation and a nice head. Roasted malt notes on the aroma with caramel and wheat. Full bodied with wheat and malt flavours and a stunning creamy mouthfeel. Lignering finish with a well balanced bitterness.

beers.name: Wodan
beers.tastingNote: Bronze coloured with a nice head. Dried fruit on the nose, hints of nuts. Lovely balance, not too sweet on the palate. Gentle nut notes on the finish. A lovely beer.

beers.name: Kellerbier Dunkel
beers.tastingNote: Gentle and well-balanced. Dark chestnut brown in colour, and soft, with a medium body and a short finish. Some nice gentle roasted flavours, reminiscent of malt loaf. Some restrained sweetness, but not cloying. Nicely balanced.

beers.name: Barley Wine
beers.tastingNote: Strong malt aromatics on the nose with a dark fruit sweetness. Very complex flavour profile and well balanced. Sherry dominates the flavours leading into a warming, alcoholic finish.

favourites.name: Select
favourites.tastingNote: Amber in appearance, with a thick, dense head that is well-retained. It offers aromas of jammy fruit, some resin, and caramel, alongside a hint of citrus. The palate similarly offers stone fruit as well as a certain softness, with some oxidisation.
